abstract: Stephane Richard, chief executive of French telecom company Orange, travels to Israel to personally apologize to Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu over confusion created by his statement about company's plan to distance itself from Israeli mobile phone provider Partner Communications; Richard says statement had been misinterpreted to mean company was supporting boycott of Israel.
lead_paragraph: Stéphane Richard said his comments were “distorted and misunderstood” as part of a movement to boycott companies operating in Israeli settlements in the West Bank.

headline.main: French Executive Apologizes to Netanyahu After His Remarks Prompt an Uproar
headline.print_headline: French Executive Apologizes to Netanyahu After His Remarks Prompt an Uproar

snippet: Stéphane Richard said his comments were “distorted and misunderstood” as part of a movement to boycott companies operating in Israeli settlements in the West Bank.
